tip.responsetimeout: Tip: The default response timeout can be overridden by setting msg.timeout.
tip.split: Tip: the "Split on" character is used to split the input into separate messages. Can accept chars ($), escape codes (\n), or hex codes (0x03).
tip.silent: Tip: In line-silent mode timeout is restarted upon arrival of any character (i.e. inter-byte timeout).
tip.timeout: Tip: In timeout mode timeout starts from arrival of first character.
tip.count: Tip: In count mode msg.count can override the configured count as long as it smaller than the configured value.
tip.waitfor: Tip: Optional. Leave blank to receive all data. Can accept chars ($), escape codes (\n), or hex codes (0x02).
tip.addchar: Tip: This character is added to every message sent out to the serial port. Usually \r or \n.
